alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Carter; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 6:20AM CDT until August 04 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN BOLLINGER, CARTER AND WAYNE COUNTIES... At 620 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing moderate to occasionally heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3.50 inches of rain has fallen. While the heaviest rain has come to an end, additional rainfall amounts of one half to one inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding remains possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Piedmont, Van Buren, Greenville, Sam A. Baker State Park, Lake Wappapello State Park, Ellsinore, Williamsville, Hunter, Lodi, Shook, Wappapello, Cascade, Fremont, Grandin and Mill Spring. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
